DESCRIPTION: On or about 02:00 AM, 08 November 2024, MV Aries 1 run aground at the shallow sea water of Brgy. Victoria, Currimao, Ilocos Norte due to heavy waves and strong winds brought by TC 'MARCE'.

On or about 03:00am November 8, 2024,LCT Panphil 8 run aground at Brgy. Gaang, Currimao, Ilocos Norte due to heavy waves and strong winds brought by TC 'MARCE'. The anchores of said the vessel were pulled out and dragged to the shallow sea water of the said barangay.

-On 08 November 2024, at about 9:20 AM, a maritime incident occurred at the Abra River Brgy. San Mariano, Bantay, Ilocos Sur. -The victim's family went out on a bamboo raft to search and rescue their goats. While they were in the middle of the river, the raft capsized due to the strong current, causing them to drift away. -A total of 1 injured and 1 missing person were reported.
ACTIONS_TAKEN: PNP, BFP and MDRRMC Bantay conducted SRR for to the missing person while the injured victim was brought to Ilocos Sur Provincial Hospital, Tamag Vigan City, Ilocos Sur.

DESCRIPTION: 229 families affected, below the knee level
Flooding occurred in Sitio Bannag, with the road leading to the area submerged up to 4 feet deep. However, the water level within the community itself is approximately 1 foot deep.

REMARKS: Initial report still subject for validation

DESCRIPTION: Medium-scale movement of soil, rocks and debris after heavy rainfall
ACTIONS_TAKEN: Issued road advisory, coordinated with the clearing operations team of the PDRRMC
REMARKS: Needs immediate intervention as houses are located within the landslide prone are. This has been the 4th time of landslide occurrence since Typhoon Julian.
